reviewText: A moving portrayal of a woman beaten down by the ugliness of life!  I think Tichina did a wonderful job; she should do more projects like this.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I'm glad that Lena's story is being told and that this injustice is not being forgotten.  This is a very tragic story about a woman named Lena Baker who lived in Georgia who has since been exonerated posthumously for a crime that the all white jury who convicted her knew she didn't commit.  Tichina Arnold does an outstanding job of portraying Lena Baker.  her acting is great.
summary: I'm Glad Lena Baker's Story is Being Told

reviewText: I have said it many times and still believe that if I lived back in theses days of slavery, I would have been dead.This woman endured too much for the sake of this fool that seemed obsessed by a man who couldn't stand up for her when it was needed. A mother and children lost her due to ignorance and silly laws because of the color of skin.A precious life lost,and to see and say but it still goes on today .This  movie get a 10.

reviewText: Tichina Arnold' portrayal of Lena Baker is haunting, intense and masterful.  Another heartbreaking chapter from African-American history.  It was unfair of the life, struggles, pain, and hell Ms Baker had gone through - just like the mistreatment of of African-Americans past as well as present.  I was educated of learning about her story.

reviewText: WOW what a crazy life story. Racism back then was crazy, who could ever imagine how it was to be African-American and living in such mayhem because of the color of ones skin.  Glad I watched it.

reviewText: I love true stories but, this has got to be one of the saddess movies I've ever watched. How could people be so cold-hearted and cruel. This was more of a documentary, it seemed unreal because she had no other life than being abused by a man, yet she had three children (none of which were his). The movie never showed her having a relationship with anyone except her mom, children and the abuser who stole her away in the night.
summary: So sad, new meaning to the word abuse
Title: N/A

reviewText: Being born and raised in South Georgia I have always been interested in this great misscarriage of justice. I live about 40 miles from the town where this happened. When I learned about the saga of Lena Baker I went to the Library and looked this up. I could never understand how a white man could go to Lenas' house abduct her at gunpoint and nothing could be done. As I grew older and wiser I learned why nothing was done. Simply by the color of her skin.The movie makes every thing clear. Watch  the movie and you will be enlightened of how things were in Georgia durings the 40's 50's and 60's and beyond!

reviewText: When a movie is good, it's just entertaining.  When a movie is educational & informative, it's great.  This movie is all three.  Well worth the time spent.  Of course it's a sad story of a terrible injustice, but I couldn't help but chuckle when the trial began & the "Judge" says, "As you can see, we have a seated jury of your peers," & the camera pans over the "jury of Ms. Baker's peers" - a group of white people with hatred & contempt on their faces.Her pardon 60 years later??  Too little too late.
Title: N/A
